elements.title: David Bentley Hart
elements.contents: ... that in a recent book, David Bentley Hart – a New Testament translator and proponent of the existence of fairies – engages in dialogues with his dog Roland (both pictured)?

elements.title: Prilep's Old Bazaar
elements.contents: ... that Prilep's Old Bazaar contains a leaning clock tower?

elements.title: Hessian State Chancellery
elements.contents: ... that in 1945 the US Army confiscated the Hotel Rose in Wiesbaden, which is now the Hessian State Chancellery?

elements.title: Omar
elements.contents: ... that the opera Omar, about the Muslim scholar Omar ibn Said, had its world premiere in a theater located less than a mile from the site where he was sold as a slave?

elements.title: Panzer Dragoon II Zwei
elements.contents: ... that Panzer Dragoon II Zwei features a villain inspired by Dune's Baron Harkonnen, visuals inspired by the work of Jean Giraud, and a fictional language?

elements.title: Andrew Klemencic
elements.contents: ... that Andrew Klemencic said "I don't think that I blockaded the streets nearly as bad as the Salvation Army" after Hawaii police fined him for speaking on a street corner in 1900?

elements.title: Monument to the Victims of the Holocaust
elements.contents: ... that the Monument to the Victims of the Holocaust in Madrid was the first Holocaust memorial in Spain when it opened in 2007?

elements.title: Roger Bonk
elements.contents: ... that football linebacker Roger Bonk was nicknamed "the Boinker"?
